info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 4:26PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CALHOUN... VICTORIA...EAST CENTRAL GOLIAD AND NORTH CENTRAL REFUGIO COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM CST... At 425 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Inez to near Saxet Lakes to 11 miles south of Fannin. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Victoria, McFaddin, Guadalupe, Victoria Colony Creek Country Club, Dacosta, Wood Hi, Bloomington, Victoria Riverside Park, Placedo, Victoria College, Saxet Lakes, Brentwood Subdivision, Oak Village, Inez, Victoria Regional Airport, Telferner, and Downtown Victoria. This includes the following highways... US Highway 59 between mile markers 624 and 652. US Highway 77 between mile markers 584 and 598. US Highway 87 between mile markers 810 and 832. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
